byline.contributor: Ben Sisario and Conor Dougherty contributed reporting.

abstract: Apple unveils revamped music products, which will incorporate Beats music service, at company's annual conference for software developers, in bid to compete against services like Spotify and Pandora; presentation underscores degree to which Apple recognizes that it must grab spotlight, in addition to giving customers comparable offerings, to compete.
lead_paragraph: The new streaming service, which will cost $10 a month, will compete with Spotify and be offered alongside an overhauled iTunes Radio.

headline.main: Apple Music Is Unveiled, Along With Operating System Upgrades
headline.print_headline: Apple Plays a New Tune at Its Latest Unveiling

snippet: The new streaming service, which will cost $10 a month, will compete with Spotify and be offered alongside an overhauled iTunes Radio.
